title: a1707  820-00928
message: a1707 water damaged , no 20v boost replaced cd3215 4 ic. any help[ATTACH type="full"]60296[/ATTACH]

title: a1707  820-00928
message:
First of all, welcome to the forum!

All 4 CD3215 chips affected by liquid?

Post voltage and diode mode to ground at LDO rails of CD3215 chips.
Do you get 3v3_G3H at least?

title: a1707  820-00928
message: Actually cd3215 not affected by water. See picture. Only corner area . Water . I cleaned well . Checked any resistance  disconnect. All good. And all boltages on 4 cd ics fine. I double checked, gr value also fine. ( injave an working board copared gr ok).  4 ports 5v looping. . Same issies have 2 boards.

title: a1707  820-00928
message: 3v3_G3H. Yes 3.4v fine. Ldo 3.3 and 1.8 b on 4 cd ic  fine. Smc 3.3 amd 1.8 and 1.2 fine . Smc reset fine.  There is no 12 b temporary. Even .

title: a1707  820-00928
message:
Please, take your time and write correctly.
We need to understand you, if need help.

You've replaced the 4 chips, even not affected by liquid, why?
So you get now 1V1 LDO_BMC on each chip?

Check diode mode to ground at F7000/1; be sure the fuses are good.
Connect known good battery (with some charge) and check voltage again.
Check if board tries to turn on in this case.
Also check if USB-C ports switch to 20V, if battery is present.

title: a1707  820-00928
message:
1V1 LDO_BMC on each chip yes its  present , with battery will update tomorrow.. no short on f7000, and fuses good.

CAN I USE POWER SUPPLY 12V INSTED OF BATTERY?

title: a1707  820-00928
message:
No, try its battery first.
But need to test with known good one, which also holds some charge.

title: a1707  820-00928
message: when i connect with charging battery . its loping 20v, and current draw 0v, fan spin speed .

title: a1707  820-00928
message:
If fan spins, check voltage on big coils.
Measure L7211 start voltage and after 10-15s, if present.

title: a1707  820-00928
message: fan spin fast,then stop, 0v on l7211

title: a1707  820-00928
message:
Try to catch voltage when fan spins.
Check if voltage tries at least to appear at L7900/60, L7330 and L7211.

title: a1707  820-00928
message:
L7900 voltage should appear before fan starts to spin even.
Check diode mode to ground there.
PM_SLP_S4_L should be present.

Remember to check when fan spins...

title: a1707  820-00928
message: Sorry . Actually 1.1 ldo very low on one chip. I replaced that cd . Now machine working. Thanks for your great support.
